newsitem.title: USA: U.S. crudes remain firm on extended price rallying.
newsitem.headline: U.S. crudes remain firm on extended price rallying.

text.p: U.S. crudes rallied sharply Thursday afternoon, supported by a surging gasoline sector and follow-through technical buying on the NYMEX futures market.

June West Texas Intermediate/Cushing was around 70 cents higher in middle afternoon activity at $20.25-35 a barrel. Front month gains erased the discount held to second month July barrels, pushing the market from a contango state to backwardation.

Bearish sentiment in the market had forced June prices below July in recent weeks, or contango. Backwardation is the normal state for market values, with front months holding premiums to the months that follow.
Narrow June/July spreads also boosted WTI/Cushing Postings markets to trade above the $1.90-95 level, some 10 cents firmer than trades seen on Wednesday.
Light Louisiana Sweet/St. James was talked late at 1-2 cents over the benchmark, with Midland/WTI safely steady at a 30 cents discount to June WTI/Cushing.
West Texas Sour/Midland remained valued at $1.60 under the marker, with Eugene Island at $1.45 under WTI.
